extendedInfo.description: Complain App helps you submit complaints to businesses instantly!*** ComplainApp is Recommended on CNET: http://cnet.co/nRC7Hb When you have a complaint about a company, most people find that contacting it via social networks is the fastest way to get your complaint resolved. Complain App (pat. pend) helps you write effective complaints and quickly submit them companies over multiple social networks such as Facebook, Twitter, Google and LinkedIn.But it doesn't end there - we don't stop until your complaint is resolved!Complain App:* helps you write great, effective complaints* submit complaints to the right address, via multiple social networks -- in one click* tracks responses and notifies you when they arrive* re-sends your complaint until it's answered* reminds you to follow up* connects you to people who have similar complaints* harnesses the power of the group to get results!Use ComplainApp for Android when youâre out at a shop, at the airport or just mad at your cable company. It's easy to use, so you can get the complaint off your chest quickly and move on with the rest of your day.How do we submit complaints?First - you control your complaint, and you decide how it's submitted. We recommend that you start with social networks like Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn, where companies answer fastest. If that doesn't work, we keep pursuing your claim until you get results.So, next time you have a complaint, don't just whine to your friends - use ComplainApp to let the business know what's gone wrong!Keywords: complaint, gripe, complain, service, customer service, customer, support, help, airline, cable company, Comcast, AT&T, Verizon, Delta

reviews.comment: Grat concept but does little to get things done. Company I complained about responded \"But we do care\"\tand that was the end of my complaint. Now I\'m bombarded with texts with no way of stopping it. In 5 minutes I\'ve gotten over 20 texts. Should be a way to limit these incoming texts. Gets in the way of me using my phone.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Annoying UI, complained to wrong address
reviews.comment: The UI was very annoying and difficult to set up. I managed to get it to connect to Twitter but not to any of my other services, and I couldn\'t figure out why. (I\'m a senior software engineer... if *I* can\'t figure out why, there\'s a *problem*.) When I used it to make a complaint, it complained to the wrong twitter user, and then posted a \"help me!\" on my twitter feed that I found inappropriate. After this first experience I decided it was definitely easier to just complain myself, and deleted the app.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Complain about Complain
reviews.comment: No way to log in without using Twitter, Fb, Yahoo, or Google? Sorry developer I don\'t know, you do not get that info by not allowing standalone login. That\'s a lot of BS. Uninstall.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: App sucks
reviews.comment: App sucks. Doesn\'t work.
reviews.author: brian mickey

reviews.comment: Not effective. Although my complaint is resolved I have to either pay or retweet to really close it. Not an effective model and certainly non-motivati
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Buggy
reviews.comment: Only lists 4 complaints today.   4 different ones yesterday.   Yet I can not see the ones from yesterday.   Bug?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Tries hard to push you to have an either Twitter or Facebook account
reviews.comment: Philosophy of App is good, but makes your life hard if you\'re not Twitter or Facebook subscriber. UI still a bit lagging and doesn\'t flow smoothly
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Good idea, really bad UI and UX.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Buggy
reviews.comment: Buggy and slow. Why does this app not conform to any standard Android design conventions? Confusing!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: No thanks
reviews.comment: This app sucks out loud.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Login
reviews.comment: Forced to sign in with Yahoo, Facebook, Google, Twitter. Why? I want the option to make a separate account.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Interesting
reviews.comment: Its good to have this, everyone needs to spit the truth about when a manufacture screws up and that\'s how they fix the problems.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: I liked it..
reviews.comment: I like it a lot...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app!
reviews.comment: This is a great vessel to get your complaint heard when you get the runaround from corporate offices. It has helped get my complaint noticed.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Great idea. Power goes back to the people
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Be heard, get results
reviews.comment: Complainapp  ensures  we get what we deserve - great value.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: It\'s crAPP. It\'s all about signing with Twitter. As adults we should make our own choice of social network.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Horrible UI, unfriendly navigation. Cool idea, bad execution
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Wow... \"bad UI\" doesn\'t even begin to do justice to this app. Great concept, though. I\'m willing to stick around for awhile.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Good idea but horrible, horrible UI
